topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0: Managing Object Storage (Swift) Rings

body.p: The rings are machine-readable description of which disk drives are used by Swift (for example: a drive is used to store account or object data). Rings also specify the policy for data storage (for example: defining the number of replicas). The rings are automatically built during the initial deployment of the system with the configuration provided during the setting up your HPE Helion OpenStack Input Model (for more information, refer to ).

After successful deployment of cloud, you may want to change or modify your cloud configuration for Swift, like:
Adding or removing Swift nodes
Adding additional storage policies
Upgrading the size of disk drives used by Swift
Some of the above changes require the rebuild of the rings.

p.note: The process of modifying or adding a configuration is similar to other configuration or topology change in the cloud. Generally, you make the changes to the input model files at ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/ and run ansible playbooks to reconfigure the system.

body.p: Changes to the rings require several phases to complete the process of deployment . Therefore, you need to run the playbooks several times over several days.
